name: Ski Lift Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very friendly man at the front desk; easy to check-in that evening; ate dinner at the restaurant and had a good steak; good continental breakfast the next morning; personable and friendly restaurant staff.
reviews.title: A great value

likes.disliked: — Room was small, only one nightstand

reviews.title: Simple, Clean, Good value for skiers

reviews.text: When we first opened the door to our room (unit 6), the smell was awful and reminded us of a musty, stinky odor ... we had to leave the door open for a while to air out the room; found old M&Ms on the floor and a lot of small debris indicating that the carpet hadn't been vacuumed in a while; the tub was filthy, and I had to run a towel along the rim (the towel literally turned black); pulled the blinds open on the window and the sill was covered in dust and dead flies; the shower / tub was raised off the floor, and if you were 6' tall or taller, you would have to stoop over to keep from hitting your head on the ceiling (I am 5'8" and the ceiling was only 4" above my head); the water pressure in the shower was almost non-existent, as I had to stand directly under the shower head and let the water dribble over me; you had to flush the toilet two or three times after using it because the flushing pressure wasn't enough to get even a small amount of toilet paper down on the first flush.
reviews.title: Find Some Place Else to Stay

reviews.text: Overall, I was disappointed and would not stay there again. I chose this place to be close to the Arizona Snowbowl Ski Area, but next time would opt to make the additional drive into Flagstaff.
reviews.title: Bathroom dirty
A great time
reviews.text: We just got back from the Ski Lift Lodge. I made the reservations and then read the review from the guy who had the bad experience. Needless to say we were a little worried about what might happen. We ended up having a great time. The room was nothing fancy, but was clean. The sheets and towels smelled fine and they didn't appear to have a problem with laundry. When we arrived, we were also given the rules which included no outside liquor (you could bring liquor back to your room from the restaurant). They also didn't allow you to be loud and obnoxious after 10:00 p.m. which was fine with us since we were traveling with a four year old. The restaurant had great food and large portions. Over all, the Ski Lift Lodge is a quaint place to stay and we would recommend it highly. However, if you are looking for a place to party all night, then look elsewhere.

reviews.title: Never Again
reviews.text: A group of 8 spent the night of August 14th, 2004 at the Snow Bowl Lodge.

description: Regardless of whether you’re planning a visit in winter, summer, spring, or fall, these cabins are an ideal place to stay. These comfortable, affordable cabins have front porches; some even feature gas fireplaces. Enjoy the nightly dinner specials in the restaurant.
